fields.description: I often run a filter to find a set of issues that should now be added to an active sprint. As I step through these issues it would be perfect if there was an operation I could select directly from the issue itself to add it to one of the currently active sprints
fields.summary: As a ScrumMaster I need to be able to add an issue to an active sprint directly from the issue itself

fields.description:
Sometimes after a sprint has started, a developer is assigned an urgent bug to fix. In some cases they have already resolved the bug before the PO or SM gets around to adding it to the sprint. There is no way to add it to the sprint (as far as I can see) unless you re-open the bug, add it to the sprint, and the re-resolve it.

This seems like another example of where the new way, adds arbitrary constraints as compared to the classic approach.
fields.summary: As a Product Manager I'd like the option to see resolved items on the backlog and add them to an active sprint

fields.description: no feedback either until its complete
fields.summary: Refresh button doesn't do anything even with 500 issues being migrated
If there are no links to migrate, probably shouldn't allow it
If dialog is blank and you click Back, you get sexy error
If dialog is blank, you can click repeatedly and get newlines
If Epic/Theme does not exist, blank migration dialog

For non-admins: if not enabled, show a message saying it is available and they have to ask an administrator to enable it.

Once enabled: show users a Feedback button. Admins also see a link to disable the feature.

Jay to provide new icon.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like for the Release Planning labs feature to be promoted on the Getting Started page

fields.description:
* Surfaced in the GH Labs Configuration tab
* Controls the visibility of any Release Planning feature/story
fields.summary: As an administrator, I would like to be able to turn on/off the Release Planning feature as a Labs Feature

fields.description:
Support team don't want to have to triage feedback which is potential support cases. We should add text to the feedback dialog to tell users that if they have a problem they should contact support instead.

Also we should mention that they may or may not receive a response through this channel.
fields.summary: Amend "Give Feedback" issue collector dialog text

fields.description: Are there supposed to be default screens already set up for greenhopper scrum? Or am I supposed to create them all manually? I did that for a Story but I don't know what all is supposed to be in the screens. I don't have anything for an Epic.
fields.summary: Screens for Greenhopper

fields.description: It would be a great feature to be able to customize the reports generated by JIRA Agile. For example: be able to add a column on the Sprint report that displays the assignee for the issue or any other field, including Custom Fields.
fields.summary: Ability to Customize the JIRA Agile Reports

fields.description: As in the Classic mode, applying the scrum template applies the Issue Type Scheme containing only the relevant the issue types. But in case of new Rapid boards, creating a project and board from the Getting started page creates the project with 'Default Issue Type Scheme' which includes every issue-type in the system. This is quite an overhead as for running scrum, we just need Epic, Story, Bug and Technical Task. The expectation is that the creation of project from within GreenHopper should use 'GreenHopper Issue Type Scheme' (or a new scheme dedicated for Rapid board usage).
fields.summary: As a JIRA Software Administrator Creation Of New Projects Should Use Only Required Issue Types

fields.description:
At the moment, you would need to click on the swimlane issuekey to open up the short summary screen on the right of Rapid board in Work Mode to see the Story points estimation. It would be great if we can show the Story Points estimation in the swimlane view as well. The small requirement such as this could means a lot in an Agile development.

!swimlane_storypoints.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a user, to see the story points in the swimlane view in Work Mode (for Story-based swimlanes)

fields.description:
It seems that the feeds on the [GreenHopper KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Greenhopper+Knowledge+Base+Home] does not retrieve any feeds.   

I have tested this on [JIRA KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Knowledge+Base+Home] and it works.  

!kbfeed.png!
fields.summary: RSS feeds for GreenHopper KB are empty

fields.description: see screenshot

fields.description: It would be good if available epics were able to be chosen when selecting the Epic Link criteria in JIRA's Basic Search.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to search for issues of an epic using Basic Search
Change description to be more accurate with new config.
Relational operators should not be supported for Sprint field
IDV Delete dialog  wider to allow for standard message on a single line
Detail View config - fields are in random order. Should be better structured or alphabetical.
Detail view does not show epic (name) by default
As a user, I would like to be able to add the GH Sprint field as a basic criteria in the Issue Navigator
Wallboard Gadget - Multi-select too wide for container
docs for new Admin feature: Epic migration

fields.description:
As can be seen in the screenshot(s) below, the *Description* field is not shown like the default renderer from the View Issue Screen:

_Green Hopper 6.0.7_
!description_renderer_1.JPG!

_GreenHopper 6.1.1_
!description_renderer_1.JPG!

As the user would like this to be displayed just like the one in the View Issue Screen, it will be helpful if *Rapid Board* can adapt to this as well:
!view_issue_description.JPG!
fields.summary: Rapid Boards Description field to be rendered as the one in the View Issue screen

fields.description:
We plan our backlog out in a rolling 3 month sprint cycle. It would be nice if I could set expected sprint start and end dates as I plan in our grooming session based on the number of story points our sprint team generally gets done. 

As of now I can only set sprint start and end dates for any currently active sprints.
fields.summary: As an Agile Board user I'd like to be able to set start and end dates on sprint placeholder in Plan Mode

fields.description:
All of the values below will need to be grouped by instance:

- how many instances are actually activated (measurement: for every instance with GH enabled, make sure we store first visit to an instance - most likely to be /secure/Dashboard.jspa, which is in JIRA) 

- of these instances, how many find Rapid Boards (measurement: first visit to /secure/RapidStart.jspa in an instance) + how many of the ones without GH at first had them (this necessary to have the numbers right for the following points)
 -- Event is "gh.welcome.show"

- how many attempt to create a project? (measurement: opening of the dialogue to create a project)
 -- Event: "gh.welcome.create.project.start" with type in "label" field

- how many create a project + how many create a project of each type (scrum, kanban, diy) + how many create sample/non-sample projects? (measurement: store project_created as an event, with type associated to it, as well as if it was a sample project).
 -- Event: "gh.welcome.create.project.sampleData" with type in "label" field preceding the next event in case of simple data is used
 -- Event: "gh.welcome.create.project.complete" with type in "label" field

- how many non-sample projects create a single issue (measurement: store issue_created event)
 -- Event: "gh.issue.created" with keys array stringified in "keys" field

- of scrum non-sample users, how many create a sprint (measurement: sprint_created event)
 -- Event: "gh.rapidboard.sprint.backlog.addmarker"

- of scrum non-sample users, how many start a sprint (measurement: sprint_started event)
 -- Event: "gh.start.sprint.dialog.change.start" when attempt to start the sprint
 -- Event: "gh.start.sprint.dialog.change.complete" when they actually start it

+

- how many users use rapid boards exclusively, how many use a mix, how many use classic exclusively - the first and last is what we cannot determine at the moment (measurement: store requests to RapidBoard.jspa vs the other two classic boards, then count these per week grouping by instance). Note that this is actual usage grouped instance, as opposed to usage overall (so larger instances having more influence) or binary on/off "has ever used a classic/rapid board"
 -- Event: "gh.rapidboard.show" on view of rapid board
 -- Event: "gh.classic.show" on view of classic board


From Jay:

- How many epics appear on a board
 -- Event "gh.rapidboard.epics" with "value" field as count

- How many versions appear on a board
 -- TBD

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: What if 1 action triggers more than 1 event?
A: (/) It could and probably will - its up to the post-processing to effectively filter, order & group the events.
fields.summary: Add Atlassian Analytics events to GH

fields.description:
h3. Steps to replicate:

# Go to the plan mode of a board
# Enable two quick filters (such as 'Only My Issues' and 'Recently Updated')
# Create an issue
# Click into the first of the two issues so that it shows in the preview plane
# Click the cog on the issue and select more actions
# Enter 'convert to sub-task'
# Go through the wizard and convert the issue to a sub-task and finally hit finish.

h3. Result: 

The URI will become 'https://instance.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=2&view=planning&quickFilter=3&quickFilter=3' and only one of the QuickFilters will be selected

If you have three filters selected then the quickfilter parameter will repeat 3 times. If you go tick the quickfilters again and then convert another issue to a sub-task then you'll end up with even more quickfilters in the URI. Eventually this will cause an error as the number of filters will cause the URI to become too long and the page will not load.

h3. Expected result:

The URI should read 'https://instance.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=2&view=planning&quickFilter=3&quickFilter=4' and both of the quick filters will be selected.

h3. Workaround:

You will need to click on the quick filter that is repeated enough times to stop the repeating.
fields.summary: quickFilter repeats in URI when leaving and returning to board when multiple filters are selected
document that existing fields are now configurable in the Issue Detail View
document : see an Epic's stories in JIRA View Issue

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master, I'd like to be able to store Sprint information in a custom field, a label or a tag. It would be independent of the work being done on the Issues, and only linked to the Sprint as a whole. I would also like to add attachments to Sprints.

+*Use case example:+*
- Defining a Spring goal.
- Sprint status is determined by the team based on business circumstances. E.g. a planned Sprint can be awaiting approval and ready for development, and one in progress can be progressing or being interrupted. It would be handy to have that information visible on the Board.
- Mockups for Sprint goals need to be attached on a Sprint level.


//

Incorporates the duplicated issue GHS-5396 {{As a Scrum user I can set a sprint goal so that I am reminded of the sprint's intention throughout}}
fields.summary: Ability to save Sprint goal and/or other properties in a separate field or tag

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

When a Story that was in some closed sprints (or active sprint) is cloned, the cloned story would retain the values of the Sprint field (even for the closed sprints).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Story in a Scrum Board
# Place the story in a sprint
# Complete the sprint
# Clone the Story
# The cloned story will still retain the values of the Sprint field

h3. Additional Findings

* The cloned story will retain all the values of the Sprint field of the parent issue, including closed sprints and any active sprint
fields.summary: Cloned Stories retain values of Sprint field from parent issue

fields.description:
It would be great that the user in the planning mode can view the following estimations:
# Story points for Stories and another metric, namely
# Remaining estimates for technical tasks and bugs.
fields.summary: Overview for Story Point and Remaining estimates types of estimation measurement can show in Rapid Board

fields.description: Why is it not possible to show time on a KanBan card but it is possible on a Agile card? Please could you transfer the possibility from the Agile cards to the Kanban Cards. There is plenty of room for this and it gives vital infomation to the developers (for example; I have an hour to do some extra work, we have about 40 issues wich one should I take? The developer now has to open every card to show what time is involved which could take up to 15 minutes to find one that could be handled. Now he loses 15 minutes of his precious time!)
fields.summary: Time in cards on KanBan board

fields.description: It would be a great addition to have the Issue View screen to include a panel (similar to sub-tasks) which can show all the connected stories while viewing an Epic.
fields.summary: As a User I would like to See All The Stories In an Epic
As a developer I want the story to change to in progress if I move the 1st task so that I don't have to remember to do this.

fields.description:
Currently we have multiple teams working on multiple backlogs but we all share the same sprints, so I would like to add a sprint and have that sprint pushed to various rapid boards. This means that sprints that have not started yet will be available on other boards for teams to plan. 

Currently we have to have 1 board for sprint planning and use filters to show the various teams work. Its ok and it works but we found it was better on the classic view when a sprint was created for everyone.
fields.summary: As a scrummaster I would like to add sprints on 1 or more rapid boards so that teams can share a sprint

fields.description:
As a user, looking at a scrum board, I would like a quick filter to show me all stories and all sub-tasks thereof IF I am assigned to either the story or ANY of the sub-tasks.

This would show more than just "my Issues". All that shows me is what I'm assigned to. Helpful sometimes, but it doesn't give me a context.
For example, if my testing sub-task depends on a developer finishing another sub-task, I want to see both my testing sub-task and his coding sub-task so I see its status and know if I can start testing.
fields.summary: As a user I would like a quick filter to show me all assigned cards with context.

fields.description: As a scrum master I would like to be able to create a fixed set of subtasks that I can upload for a certain story, so that I can speed up the process of populating the scrum board when starting a sprint.
fields.summary: Sprint Template

fields.description: Use Guava objects to implement a proper cache.
fields.summary: Refactor the cache in SprintManager

fields.description: We hide other content when GH is expired (e.g. Agile menu options, Browse Project tab panel). We should do this here as well.
fields.summary: Agile Issue Panel shows up even when GH license is expired

fields.description: A full view for Epics would make it easier to sort Epics. The limited view on the left side of the screen doesn't give enough space to rank quickly. Other tools to help rank Epics like Move to Top would help as well.
fields.summary: Epic ranking tools

fields.description:
I think it would be a great addition if you made the Epic Tags found in a Story (et al) Detail View and in Backlog/Sprint lists hot.

So clicking on it will bring you to the Epic and it's list of Epic Stories.

Thanks!
Rick
fields.summary: Request Epic Tags (Titles) should be hot.

fields.description:
h5. Current Status

An user will only be able to "Release" a GH Sprint if he has the Administration permission over the project.

h5. Expected Behaviour

There are a lot of cases which users should be able to Release a sprint without being project Administrator.

h5. Note

Note that the person can already do a bulk update to accomplish the same thing, so it's hard to justify why the user can't release the sprint without being a project admin.
fields.summary: As an user, I would like to be able to Release a Sprint without being a Project Administrator

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Create a board including at least 2 projects (PROJECT A, PROJECT B)
* Create a sprint and add issues from both projects to it
* Make a copy of the board (the sprint will be copied too)
* Create a new filter to exclude PROJECT A from the new board 
* Create a new filter to exclude PROJECT B from the original board 
* Try to complete the sprint on one of the boards, you will notice the sprint on the other board is also completed. Sprints should behave independently.
fields.summary: Closing a Sprint on a board that was copied from another causes the original Sprint to be closed as well

fields.description: In GreenHopper Issue Detail View, it would be nice to be able to switch between Detail, Comments, Attachments, and Sub-Tasks using just keyboard shortcuts.
fields.summary: As a User I would like to be able to switch between tabs in Issue Detail View using the Keyboard
As a user, I want to be able to see default browser menu when I right click on an issue link

fields.description:
robots.txt does not disallow RankBottom/RankTop URLs and causes Google Search Engine Robot to perform GET Request

Quoted from a customer:

Our site is being indexed by an internal Google Search Appliance to allow for corporate wide searching of data on a Google like web site. This works fine. However we have discovered a bug in Jira.

The robot will eventually crawl the URL /secure/RankBottom.jspa?issueId=731327  (take any issueId) and will perform a GET request. We can clearly see this in the web log:

{noformat}
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /browse/CR-2301 HTTP/1.0" 302 - "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /robots.txt HTTP/1.0" 200 457 "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /robots.txt HTTP/1.0" 200 457 "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /robots.txt HTTP/1.0" 200 457 "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /browse/CR-2301 HTTP/1.0" 302 - "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /robots.txt HTTP/1.0" 200 457 "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
10.110.10.45 - - [22/Jan/2013:01:59:59 +0100] "GET /browse/CR-77242 HTTP/1.0" 200 65150 "-" "Mozilla%2F5.0%20%28Macintosh%3B%20U%3B%20Linux%20i686%3B%20en-US%3B%20rv%3A1.8%29%20Gecko%2F20051111%20Firefox%2F1.5%20GSA%2F1 (Enterprise; T3-KT3WUATTQWSQY; ken.ramey@ptn.advantest.com)"
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&jqlQuery=project+%3D+TEST72+AND+fixVersion+%3D+%227.2.0.1-FV2i%22+AND+resolution+in+(Fixed%2C+%22Will+not+fix%22%2C+Duplicate%2C+%22Cannot+Reproduce%22%2C+%22User+%2F+Usage+Error%22%2C+%22Fixed+-+no+code+change%22%2C+Done%2C+%22Device+issue+%2F+Test+Case+issue%22%2C+%22Fixed+by+other+CR%22%2C+Incomplete) HTTP/1.0" 200 29221 "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.43.21 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /secure/RankBottom.jspa?issueId=665852 HTTP/1.0" 404 3272 "-" "Mozilla%2F5.0%20%28Macintosh%3B%20U%3B%20Linux%20i686%3B%20en-US%3B%20rv%3A1.8%29%20Gecko%2F20051111%20Firefox%2F1.5%20GSA%2F1 (Enterprise; T2-FYN8SNNZFNWJB; ken.ramey@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.43.21 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /secure/RankTop.jspa?issueId=632961 HTTP/1.0" 404 3269 "-" "Mozilla%2F5.0%20%28Macintosh%3B%20U%3B%20Linux%20i686%3B%20en-US%3B%20rv%3A1.8%29%20Gecko%2F20051111%20Firefox%2F1.5%20GSA%2F1 (Enterprise; T2-FYN8SNNZFNWJB; ken.ramey@non.verigy.com)"
10.16.44.43 - - [22/Jan/2013:02:00:00 +0100] "GET /secure HTTP/1.0" 302 - "-" "gsa-crawler (Enterprise; T3-DU2NDCX3QWWQG; scott.morrell@non.verigy.com,ken.ramey@non.verigy.com,jim.osborne@non.verigy.com)"
{noformat}

However the robots.txt file delivered with Jira does not "Disallow" the RankBottom / RankTop URLs. This has lead to issue corruption in one of our projects as the Google Searcher tried to "click" rank up / down.

This violates the HTTP standard. AFAIK the standard says that GET requests may not alter data.

Below is the robots.txt included with Jira:

{noformat}
# robots.txt for JIRA
# You may specify URLs in this file that will not be crawled by search engines (Google, MSN, etc)
#
# By default, all SearchRequestViews in the IssueNavigator (e.g.: Word, XML, RSS, etc) and all IssueViews
# (XML, Printable and Word) are excluded by the /sr/ and /si/ directives below.

User-agent: *
Disallow: /sr/
Disallow: /si/
Disallow: /charts
Disallow: /secure/ConfigureReport.jspa
Disallow: /secure/ConfigureReport!default.jspa
{noformat}
fields.summary: RankBottom/RankTop should be POSTs not GETs
Investigate velocity template auto-escaping impact on GH

fields.description:
A request for a feature to allow multiple owners for Rapid Boards.

*Workaround*

Create a shared jira user for each project team. This user's credentials are shared within the team, and then we create GH boards and jira filters with these shared users. If anyone wants to update a jira filter or GH board, they just login with the shared user and change it.
fields.summary: Multiple Owners for Rapid Boards
Update Epic Report screenshot on View Available Reports page

fields.description:
As of now, Kanban boards don't display Issue estimates on cards. It would be expected, though, that users can:
- display a selected estimate field on the Board (be it Time Estimates, Story Points or any other available);
- log time and see estimated and remaining time if they're using Time Estimates.

+Use case:+ prioritization of work on the fly; better overview of work in progress.
fields.summary: Make estimates visible on cards in Kanban board in company-managed projects

fields.description: When inserting new issues into the kanban board, they automatically move to the bottom of the board. It would be nice to be able to insert issues above or below another issue rather than having to insert it and then move it. This functionality previously existed in the classic planning and task board.
fields.summary: Insert new issue in kanban board based on rank of another issue

fields.description: This issue is originally created in JIRA (JRA) project and moved to GreenHopper (GHS). Any request to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-31392 will lead that automatically to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-7262
fields.summary: Test Issue To Demonstrate Issue Move

fields.description:
Currently, you have to go to Configure for the board to switch the swimlane option to assignee, query, story on non swimlane option. It would be great if we can have a feature on the Work view of the new Rapid Boards to easily switch back and forth between the different swimlane options.

I don't want to create another board to switch between two swimlane types. I want to be able to switch in the work view on one board; otherwise, it will force me to create quick filters for what I want to do like for all assignees and then have the swimlane use the query option.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to easily switch between swimlanes within the Work Board View

fields.description:
As a team lead, I would like to enter the total team capacity for a sprint (the number of hours they have in total to work during the course of the sprint) and then see a line on the burndown that shows REMAINING TEAM CAPACITY based on total original time minus time logged on issues.

It's great that I can see the how much WORK is left, but I need to be able to compare it to how much TIME the team still has available to them.
fields.summary: Capacity line in burndown

fields.description:
For some customer that has more than 300 issues in the backlog, it would be hard to deal with all the issues where you have to scroll down to no ends. It would be really great if we can configure the maximum of issues per page on the backlog or not to have the page at all. This would be a great improvement to the current Rapid board, as you might know, this paging feature has been introduced in Classic board yet it seems not being implemented in the new Rapid board. Certain customer uses this feature and expect this to be available in the new Rapid board as well.

The page numbering should be put on top and bottom of the backlog for easier access of handling all the issues in the backlog. As an example, the following
!page3.PNG!
fields.summary: As a Rapid board user, paging feature on backlog should be implemented

fields.description:
Hi there,

We organise our work items into JIRA projects then setup EPIC/STORY/TASK issues as required. 

In the GH planning view we get a full list of all the EPICS that are created across all the projects that are of interest to us.  We can then click on an epic and filter the backlog accordingly.  We then decide what project(s) we are to work on in the active sprint and move stories to it.

What is missing is a simple (and human readable) way of identifying which project a particular epic belongs too. One solution is to mandate that each epic has to include in its name the JIRA project ID - not ideal.

Any chance of an extension to the EPIC side panel that aggregates epics into a collapsible list of projects?  Then we can expand/show/hode only projects that are of interest in that time box and plan the applicable stories?

Thanks
fields.summary: In GH scrum planning view, show the project in the epic list

fields.description:
Hi.

I've been using Tempo plugin for some time now. Tempo has the ability to define non-working days. 

I just don't want to define non-working days in several places. Are there some plans or ways to remedy this?
fields.summary: As a Tempo user I don't want to manage non-working days on several places

fields.description: timebox: half-day
fields.summary: Release Planning Prototype for User testing

fields.description:
# When trying to select Sprint field in Basic Search (see image attached), user gets "Sprint is not applicable for the current project and/or issue type". On the other hand, user *can* search for issues by Sprint through Advanced Search.
# If the project is selected in the Issue Navigator, it allows to select Sprint field in 'More Criteria' but the drop down is empty (Second attachment)
fields.summary: Ability to select Sprint in Basic Search

fields.description:
The sub-task panel has a 'Create' button to create sub-tasks quickly for an issue. It would be good to have a similar mechanism when viewing an epic, so that you can create issues for the epic.

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: How does this overwrite the current project and issuetype selection of the create issue dialog?
A: (/) No overriding is done for the create issue dialog. It behaves identical to the normal dialog. 

Q: What happens if you open the create issue for epic and create issue dialogs one after the other?
A: (/) Multiple issue creation is supported. After all issues are created and dialog is closed, then the created issues are associated with the epic

Q: What if the epic is closed?
A: (/) Issues will still be able to be associated to the epic.

Q: What if the epic doesn't exist anymore?
A: (/) An error message is shown saying the issue does not exist

Q: What if the epic has been changed to another issuetype?
A: (/) If the user is on the epic's view issue page and the epic's type is changed on another page, then creating issues in the epic work, but the association will fail with an error message saying the Issue should be of type Epic

Q: What if you have inline edits open in jira before clicking the button?
A: (/) They are closed before the dialog opens
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to create an issue inside an epic when viewing an epic in JIRA

fields.description:
The value displayed within the estimate field is different in Plan and Work mode . This is confusing, as one would expect to see the same information in this field, regardless of the mode. 
Either allow both Original and Remaining to be visible on the card, or always use/show the Remaining estimate.

Currently, you see Original Estimate in Plan Mode, but Remaining Estimate in Work mode when you have Time Tracking (Remaining Estimate and Time Spent) configured for estimation in the board configuration.
fields.summary: Inconsistent use of the Estimate field

fields.description:
While planning a new sprint I am able to see how much work is planned for the sprint in the summary row (section) below the sprint backlog. In this section I can see the amount of remaining work (estimate). This is essential for the proper planning of the sprint. We combine this with a Quick filters by Assignee in order to allow proper planning of the individual tasks.

However, once the sprint is is started, if you go to the Plan mode, you are not able to see the estimates summary row (section) below the sprint anymore. This is inconvenient as this it is hard to tell how much work is remaining - if you want to slice the work by some other criteria (besides status - statistic for which is available in the top-right corner of the sprint). 
What is needed is one of the following:
# Keep the estimates summary row (Section) below the sprint - for the started and for the not yet started sprints - the estimates summary should reflect the applied Quick Filters (as for the not started sprints), or
# Update the sprint estimate statistics (on the top-right) corner according to the selected Quick Filters.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to be able to see the remaining estimate summary in Plan mode for the started Sprint
Incorporate pull request from UPM 2.8
drop zone heights borked when swimlane is 1 issue high

fields.description:
Feature Request:
I'd like to be able to more easily track work hour estimates and logged work based on individual assignees. Currently we track hour estimates on sub-tasks within stories while stories are estimated with story points. Two related enhancements to the Agile Planning Board would make it easier to determine which team members have their time fully spoken for when planning the upcoming sprint. I know not all teams track hours, so the vissibility of these displays might need to be configurable.

1) On the Issue Details section (when an Issue is selected on the planning view of the Agile Board) show something similar to the "Time Tracking" section of the JIRA Issue page except broken out by sub-task assignee. This would show you at a glance who needs to work on this issue and how much work needs to be done by each person (because not all stories require the whole team).

2) For each Sprint (and the area above the Sprint Marker before starting a new one) show an aggregate "Time Tracking" section that breaks down hour estimates/logged for each assignee. This would show you at a glance how much each person has committed to for the sprint.
fields.summary: Add Time Tracking to the Agile Board Sprint Plan View

fields.description:

Please update the page below:

fields.summary: Documentation update

fields.description:
At the moment, we are only able to configure card colors in GreenHopper based on the following fields:
- Issue Types
- Priorities
- Assignees
- Queries

This is as per outlined in the documentation on [Configuring Card Colours|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+Card+Colours].

However, it will be great if we are able to configure the card colors based on the issue status as well.
fields.summary: Add the ability to set card colors based on the issue status

fields.description:
The GreenHopper Classic feature allowed for using contexts, to filter down pretty much everything. While the new Agile Boards come with the quick filter concept, these are unfortunately limited to the plan and work modes, but not the reports.

What our users need are reports (esp. the burn down chart), which can be filtered down on individual team member level, in order to leverage work load, track progress and identify road blocks. Ideally, all reports carry a configuration option like the control chart with following options:
- Filter on 1 to many team members
- Filter on 1 to many quick filters
fields.summary: As a Agile Board user, I want to be able to see the reports filtered on individual team member level or based on quick filters

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# install GreenHopper 6.1.x
# use "Original Estimate" for estimation the Scrum 
# create issues with Subtask. Eg: Parent Issue TST-1, Subtask: TST-2 , TST-3.
# assigned TST-1 and TST-2 to same user. Eg: user1
# assigned TST-3 to different user.Eg: user2
# create Quick Filter in Scrum, Plan mode by Assignee
# Remaining Estimate will include the Subtask not assigned to user1.
fields.summary: Subtask Not Included Sprint But Calculated In Remaining Estimate

fields.description: Outcome is a service to query fixVersion history or reasons why it can't be done with JIRA data and possible alternatives.
fields.summary: implement history data service for the fixVersion data field

fields.description:
According to your documentation drag and drop ranking is only allowed if a single ORDER BY of Rank is used in your scrum planning board filter.

Would like to sort by Epic Colour as well:

- ...  ORDER BY "Epic Colour" ASC, Rank ASC

and this sorting works (yeah!).  But of course, this breaks the Drag and Drop ranking ability:

- "Ranking is disabled, as the Filter Query for this board is not ordered by Rank. Please check your filter configuration."

Yes - I understand that only one ORDER BY is currently supported:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/GhPzE

But I am requesting ability to use multiple ORDER BYs in Scrum Planning filter view, if Rank is still last.

Thanks!
Rick
fields.summary: Request ability to use multiple ORDER BYs in Scrum Planning filter view, if Rank is still last.
JIRA Agile/Software does not respect JIRA's ISO8601 setting

fields.description:
As you can see from the attached unite-greenhopper.jpg image, we've filtered all issues belonging to a certain project component (Connectivity) and like to associate these issues to selected project versions. We need a display screen that contains project versions so that we can drag&drop issues one by one to those project versions.

In this special project each component is assigned to a project manager and each of'em needs to be able to plan his/her component from the planning board easily. Otherwise they won't be able to associate components with versions easily in Greenhopper.

Best Regards

Onur
fields.summary: we'd like to drag and drop issues that belong to a  single component to versions selectively from the planning board
